actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that individuals who do not apply for or accept employment within their capabilities will not be eligible to receive unemployment compensation.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code provisions relating to approval of State unemployment compensation laws to make individuals who have received unemployment compensation for at least 17 weeks during any benefit year and who have failed to apply for or accept employment within their capabilities ineligible to receive unemployment compensation during subsequent weeks.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that individuals who do not apply for or accept employment within their capabilities will not be eligible to receive unemployment compensation.
